p: We also conducted the microwave cavity analysis on heavy fossil oil emulsions. Compared to paraffins, both the crude oil and tar oil have a rather complex composition, containing hundreds of compounds. Due to the opaqueness of emulsified oil, one cannot measure the droplet size distribution accurately using dynamic light scattering technique. 10 Thus, it is of considerable value to examine if the microwave analysis could be applied to investigate the droplet size distribution of emulsified heavy oil.
